page.title: 01Surfleet.
page.content: Surfleet is a small village 4 miles north of{Spalding}in the heart of prime fenland agricultural land. The parish is made up more than 93% of arable crop fields with horticultural smallholdings containing glasshouses and intensively-grown salad crops. The orchards have been reduced to a tiny area. Main cash crops are sugar beet,tulip and daffodil bulbs,brassica crops,wheat and barley. Cucumbers and tomatoes are important horticultural crops. The parish is divided in two by the{A 16}road running north from Spalding to Boston. The southern boundary is the{River Glen,}a fisher_ man's stream where waterbirds abound. The village has grown recently with the building of new homes in several locations.
